events.name: HackerNest Singapore October Tech Social
events.description: **Please RSVP by Monday 17 October 10am so we can get you an access badge printed*** Exciting news! HackerNest Singapore is partnering with  Building IoT Asia Exhibition & Conference 2016 (18 – 19 October 2016 | Singapore EXPO ) and  BuildTech Asia 2016 (18 – 20 October 2016 | Singapore EXPO Halls 3 & MAX Atria)  to bring you an amazing opportunity! We have a great social event planned on October 19! First, there will be a tour of the Exhibition hall for HackerNest members before the Tech Social at Slackers Bar! Please RSVP if you're wanting to attend both or either event! Follow us on Twitter and Instagram, like us on Facebook, hi-5 us in person.  Schedule: - 5pm-6pm:  Exhibition Tour - Singapore EXPO Hall 3  - 7:00pm: HackerNest Singapore Tech Social and Conference Networking event at Slackers’ Bar & Cafe - 8pm short announcement and words from our sponsor  - 8.10pm: back to chatting with interesting new friends  - 9:00pm: go home exhausted from great conversations ***To add to the awesomeness*** We also have: •  One FREE Build-IoT Asia Conference pass for a lucky    HackerNest member! Add us on Twitter @HackerNest and  Tweet us with the #HackerNestsendmetoBuildIOT and we'll  draw a winner October 9 • If 10 people email us with the subject line: "Please  pick me for Build IoT" by 10 October you'll get conference  tickets for $450 each! Get your friends together and email us now! • 25% off regular conference tickets with the code BIOTHN-2016 when you register for the conference here. We'd love you to take advantage of this great event! RSVP and sign up for the conference and exhibition now ! ***** Sponsors make this growing movement possible - email us to chat!  Venue: Slacker's Bar and Cafe Special Thanks   https://www.facebook.com/buildtechforasia/?fref=nf  Volunteers:  Our awesome Tech Socials are volunteer run, and need people like you! Let us know if you'd like to join the Singapore team! HackerNest is an international nonprofit uniting local tech communities through unpretentious Tech Socials and hackathons. We cram lots of smart, accomplished people into a room with free drinks. Our relaxed, down-to-earth events attract a diverse and highly technical membership. Strict 'no-scuzzbag' policy.
events.location: Slacker’s Bar & Cafe, UE Convention Center, UE BizHub East, Changi, Singapore

events.name: Security Wednesdays #14 - "Security Challenges Faced in IoT"
events.description:
Presentation Description:
This talk will discuss the general challenges faced in IoT including a case study on how we managed to take over a few hundred IoT gateways. We will also discuss on why developers have difficulty implementing IoT solutions in a secure manner, what the common mistakes are and what some key pointers are to prevent them.

Speaker's Biography:
Lucas Kauffman is a cyber-security consultant at EY. He has been a pen tester for almost 5 years and holds OSCP as well as CREST CRT PEN. He joined EY Singapore from EY Belgium in December 2015 and has been focusing on testing IoT solutions. Lucas is also an active member of security.stackexchange.com and has released several guest blog posts on their website. He has been frequenting Brucon regularly in the past years as well as the Belgian OWASP chapter meetings. He’s an outgoing person, who loves beer, cheese and cookies.

-----
Stand a chance to win a free NUS Greyhats T-shirt at Security Wednesdays! Simply come down to find out out more about how you can get yours too!
events.location: NUS School of Computing COM1 0204 Seminar Room 2, , Singapore

events.name: Developing infrastructure code for CI and CD by Ravikanth Changanti
events.description: Ravi will be in town for PowerShell Conference Asia 2016 (http://psconf.asia) and will be doing a special user group meet up. Tickets for PowerShell Conference are available at a 15% discount for Meetup members using Discount Code "MEETUP" Mailing list: http://powershell.us7.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=a239a41647689f0a8b2a47b65&id=7389fe1711 PowerShell Conference Registration: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/powershell-conference-asia-2016-tickets-26365552076 Session Details:While DevOps and Infrastructure as code practices bring in several advantages to both development and operations teams, they bring in certain challenges as well. The operations team members must make the code ready for continuous integration and delivery/deployment. This involves making sure your code is unit / integration tests ready and you use patterns such as feature toggles to ensure there is less churn in rolling back changes when you have to. This session provides an overview of CI/CD for operations people and walks through several examples of developing code for CI and CD.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: IxD Session: A conversation with Priscilla Liu
events.description:
Hello everyone! The sixth instalment of the Design Leader series we'll be talking to the Priscilla Liu, Head of Experience and Design at PropertyGuru Group.  Being one of the leader in the property industry, PropertyGuru is definitely not a stranger to many of us. Come and hear about Priscilla's journey and experience leading UX and design in PropertyGuru.  About Priscilla Liu Hi everyone, I’m currently heading the UX team in PropertyGuru. With presence in 9 markets, we help 16 million people find their home every month. The UX team is responsible for learning about users, defining how users use our products and measuring the results. The team is guided by 3 principles - Human-Centered, Agile and Data Driven.  Previously, I’ve launched digital products for Commonwealth Bank, ComfortDelGro, SBS and SPH.  I’d be sharing my UX journey, what worked well, the challenges…anything goes!   PS – PropertyGuru UX team is expanding, we are hiring senior UX designer and UX researcher, please check  http://career.propertyguru.com/ if you’re interested." 


Agenda for the night  7pm – 7.30pm: Registration, drinks, snacks and networking 7.30pm – 8.30pm: Conversation with Priscilla  8.30pm – 9pm: Networking and drinks :) We're hoping to keep the session really informal and casual where it is more conversational centric so bring along some of your burning questions to the session. The value of the meetup is as good as the questions asked :) Also, if you would like to ask the question privately, please email me at kiat@ixda.sg and I'll ask them on your behalf :) Alternatively, you may like to tweet us the questions to @IxDASG and we can have that answered! A BIG thanks to PropertyGuru for providing the venue, drinks and snacks.
events.location: Property Guru, 51 Goldhill Plaza #11-03  (circular building next to United Square), Singapore

events.name: Emacs Meetup #3
events.description: Andddd... we're back! Time: 19th Oct 2016, 7.15pmVenue: Pivotal Labs, Singapore (thanks again!) Agenda: Web Development in Emacs, Common Lisp and Clojurescript. Emacs packages: SLIME, Paredit, log4slime, tramp, CIDER- Elias Mårtenson Elias has more than 2 decades of Emacs and Lisp experience, and for this talk he'll be presenting his workflow and how demonstrate how Emacs enables him to do what he does.
